basic_level.question: Which of the following is a pathological feature of osteoarthritis?
basic_level.explanation: Joint space narrowing due to articular cartilage loss is a cardinal radiographic and pathological feature of osteoarthritis.

basic_level.question: Which autoantibody is most specific for rheumatoid arthritis?
basic_level.explanation: Anti-cyclic citrullinated peptide (anti-CCP) antibodies are highly specific for rheumatoid arthritis and are useful in early diagnosis.
